title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Jane Goodall Institute
Interview Descriptions: Good, challenging questions, friendly. Some usual questions some unusual, concentrated on the role a lot. Was not made to feel nervous and the interview panel was interesting and involved. It was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: How I would manage the project

title: GIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Jane Goodall Institute (Dar es Salaam, Dar es Salaam) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were lots of inconsistencies in planning for interview. Date and time kept on being postponed on short notices. Looked like they were filling in the roaster. Also preparation time was just only one day.
Interview Questions: How to get data collected by pda from the field

title: General Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Jane Goodall Institute (Hong Kong) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not many questions but focused on the quality and passion that can be provided to the mission of the company. As it is a Non-Profit Organisation it has a more humanitarianistic approach to its employees and their dedication to the cause.
Interview Questions: Do you know Dr. Jane Goodall

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Jane Goodall Institute (Shanghai, Shanghai) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Discussed past experience, mandarin language level, education background, etc.
Interview Questions: What do I bring to the organization as a foreigner in China
